definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Members of primitive society do not distinguish between medicine, magic and religion.
sentences.chinese: 原始社会的成员并没有区别医学，魔术与宗教。

sentences.english: The chinese city wall originated in the period of LongShan Culture of the late primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 中国的城墙起源于原始社会后期，即龙山文化时代。

sentences.english: His book describes the march of the civilization of a primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 他的“着作”描述了一个原始社会的开化过程。

sentences.english: The religious dance originated from the Wu (Sorcery) Dance of the primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 宗教舞蹈直接渊源于原始社会的巫舞。

sentences.english: It was present in primitive societies both in the east and the west.
sentences.chinese: 东西方都早在原始社会就使用了勺子。

sentences.english: These dances had ripen by the end of the primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 到原始社会后期，舞蹈日趋成熟。

sentences.english: If there were not the day and night, were not the time hours, mankind would return to the primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 如果只有昼夜，没有钟点，人类将返回到原始社会。

sentences.english: This shows that by the late primitive society, Jingxing territory has been inhabited by human beings.
sentences.chinese: 这表明最迟在原始社会晚期，井陉境内已有人类聚居。

sentences.english: But there are also some tribes still remain in the late primitive society .
sentences.chinese: 但也有一些部落仍然停留在原始社会后期。

sentences.english: Banpo is a difference between the rich and not the primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 半坡是一个没有贫富差别的原始社会。

sentences.english: These are the survivals from the primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 这些是原始社会的遗物。

sentences.english: Primitive man hunted wild animals with crude stone implements.
sentences.chinese: 原始社会的人用粗糙的石器猎取野兽。

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
the Bronze Age/also written 青銅時代|青铜时代[Qing1 tong2 Shi2 dai4]
devour raw meat and fowl (of savages)
Xia, Shang and Zhou, the earliest named Chinese dynasties
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
